page.title: 01Valley north east of Ludlow
page.content: The block covers the lower slopes of hills in the west, the little narrow valleys of the Ledwyche Brook and tributary streams, Newton, Bockleton and Dogditch Brooks and some of the rising ground of Brown Clee and Titterstone Clee hills. It is highest in the NE at 330m above sea level and lowest in the SW in the valley about 152m and the general slope is this way. The main route, the Ludlow to Bridgnorth road, B4364 keeps to the higher land papallel to the valleys, diagonally across the block. There are no village settlements in the area, but a few stone cottages, some houses and bungalows along the roads and farms spread about. The farming is pasturing of sheep and beef cattle and arable.
